history.content: Have taken and do not recommend. 126 do touch on the relevant topics and I think that is enough.

children.subject: Thanks! I guess I'm gonna just self study some parts of it.

If you are planning to take 126 just study harder and read more on your own when we hit the relevant chapters. According to 126 syllabus, it seems like we are even gonna cover stats topics beyond 135 (spring 2018).

I am currently in Stat135 right now and I think the issue is that only certain sections of the course might be useful for ML, but not enough to justify taking the whole course. 

Like for example in the beginning, we cover Method of Moments estimators and Maximum Liklihood Estimators, both of which I think might be useful in the conext of "prediction/estimation" part of ML.

But currently we have been talking about z tests, t tests, and uniformly most powerful tests, which don't seem quite as relevant. 

It might be easier to self study the few parts that might be useful than spend 4 units in a semester in the course.

history.content:
I've been told that EE126 and EE127 are the best preparation for classes like CS189.But I also heard that Statistics is playing a crucial role in ML. (Or it's just the prob. theory and the inference part that helps us a lot?)

Now I'm hesitating with taking Stat135. The material looks fun, but certainly need me to put good effort to really internalize them. Not sure if it's worthwhile to spend amounts of time on it.

With that saying, would taking Stat135 benefits me for getting into the area of ML(not just for preparing CS189)  or other CS fields in general?
history.subject: Would Stat135 help me with getting ready for ML classes and research?
